summary: This case report details an investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein, focusing on allegations of inappropriate behavior and solicitation of young women for work at Epstein's residence. The report includes intelligence gathered from various sources, including college students and phone records, as well as details about the individuals involved and their connections. This document contains a series of police reports detailing incidents involving Jeffrey Epstein, including a burglary at his residence and subsequent investigations. It highlights interactions with various individuals, including Epstein's former houseman, Juan Alessi, who admitted to stealing money from Epstein's home. The reports also discuss surveillance efforts and the handling of evidence related to the case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Maxwell is reported to have hired young women from Palm Beach Atlantic College to work at her home, where inappropriate behavior allegedly occurred.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is associated with Ghislaine Maxwell and is accused of inappropriate touching of young women hired to work at his residence.

persons.name: Sgt.
persons.context: Sgt. is mentioned as a source of information regarding the investigation into Maxwell and Epstein.

persons.name: Det.
persons.context: Det. is involved in the investigation and documentation of the case against Maxwell and Epstein.

persons.name: Eric Lowdermilk
persons.context: Lowdermilk is mentioned in relation to handling discipline after a search of a student's room revealed alcohol and potentially inappropriate materials.

persons.name: Allen McEniry
persons.context: McEniry is involved in the room search conducted at Palm Beach Atlantic College as part of the investigation.

persons.name: Juan Alessi
persons.context: Alessi admitted to stealing money from Epstein's residence and was involved in discussions about returning the stolen funds.

persons.name: Michael Reiter
persons.context: Reiter is mentioned in the context of police procedures and responses to subpoenas related to Epstein's case.

persons.name: George le
persons.context: Le is mentioned in relation to police procedures and responses to subpoenas regarding Epstein.

persons.name: Joseph
persons.context: Joseph is mentioned in the context of the investigation into Epstein's activities and interactions with Alessi.

persons.name: Valdwon Cotrin
persons.context: Cotin is mentioned as a staff member at Epstein's residence who reported not hearing anything unusual during the burglary.

persons.name: Marie Alessi
persons.context: Marie is mentioned in relation to her husband's actions and their separation during the investigation.

persons.name: John Alessi
persons.context: John is mentioned in the context of his father's mental health and interactions with law enforcement.

connections.description: Maxwell and Epstein are alleged to have worked together in recruiting young women for inappropriate activities.
Maxwell is reported to have hired students from the college to work at her home.
Epstein is accused of inappropriate touching of the young women hired by Maxwell.
Sgt. and Det. are both involved in the investigation into Maxwell and Epstein.
Both are staff members at Palm Beach Atlantic College involved in the investigation and handling of student discipline.
Juan Alessi worked as a houseman for Jeffrey Epstein and later admitted to stealing money from him.
Juan and Marie Alessi are estranged spouses going through divorce proceedings.
Juan Alessi is the father of John Alessi, who was involved in discussions about his father's mental health.
Michael Reiter, as Chief of Police, was involved in the investigation of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Initial Intelligence Received
events.description: Palm Beach Police received intelligence regarding Ghislaine Maxwell hiring young women from PBAC.

events.title: Trash Pulls Initiated
events.description: Investigators began trash pulls related to the case, discovering various intelligence items.

events.title: Investigative Subpoena Completed
events.description: An investigative subpoena was completed requesting all incoming and outgoing lines to Epstein's residence.

events.title: Room Search Conducted
events.description: A room search was conducted at Palm Beach Atlantic College, revealing alcohol and potentially inappropriate materials.

events.title: Burglary at Epstein's Residence
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein reported a burglary at his home where cash and a handgun were stolen.

events.title: Alessi Admits to Theft
events.description: Juan Alessi admitted to Epstein that he broke into the house and took money, stating he was contemplating suicide.

events.title: Epstein Declines Prosecution
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein decided not to prosecute Juan Alessi after he returned some of the stolen money.

locations: 358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, FL
Palm Beach Atlantic College, West Palm Beach, FL
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell allegedly hired young women from Palm Beach Atlantic College for work at her home.
Several college students reported inappropriate touching by Jeffrey Epstein.
Investigators conducted trash pulls that revealed intelligence items related to massages and lists of women.
Epstein and Maxwell were found to have numerous phone lines and vehicles registered in their names.
A room search at PBAC revealed alcohol and papers related to adult work.
Jeffrey Epstein reported a burglary at his residence where approximately $3,500 was stolen from a briefcase.
Juan Alessi, a former houseman, admitted to stealing money from Epstein's home and expressed suicidal thoughts.
Epstein decided not to prosecute Alessi after he returned $2,000 of the stolen money.
